Description détaillée
Crawler eases navigation of a list of \DOMNode objects.
Auteur
Fabien Potencier fabien@symfony.com
<int, \DOMNode>

Documentation des fonctions membres
add() addCrawler Crawleradd
add ( $node)
Adds a node to the current list of nodes.
This method uses the appropriate specialized add*() method based on the type of the argument.
Paramètres
\DOMNodeList | \DOMNode | \DOMNode[] | string | null$node
A node
Exceptions
InvalidArgumentException when node is not the expected type Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :

addContent() addContentCrawler CrawleraddContent
addContent (string $content, ?string $type = null )
Adds HTML/XML content.
If the charset is not set via the content type, it is assumed to be UTF-8, or ISO-8859-1 as a fallback, which is the default charset defined by the HTTP 1.1 specification. Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :
Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :

addHtmlContent() addHtmlContentCrawler CrawleraddHtmlContent
addHtmlContent (string $content, string $charset = 'UTF-8' )
Adds an HTML content to the list of nodes.
The libxml errors are disabled when the content is parsed.
If you want to get parsing errors, be sure to enable internal errors via libxml_use_internal_errors(true) and then, get the errors via libxml_get_errors(). Be sure to clear errors with libxml_clear_errors() afterward. Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :
Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :

addXmlContent() addXmlContentCrawler CrawleraddXmlContent
addXmlContent (string $content, string $charset = 'UTF-8' , int $options = \LIBXML_NONET )
Adds an XML content to the list of nodes.
The libxml errors are disabled when the content is parsed.
If you want to get parsing errors, be sure to enable internal errors via libxml_use_internal_errors(true) and then, get the errors via libxml_get_errors(). Be sure to clear errors with libxml_clear_errors() afterward.
Paramètres
int$options
Bitwise OR of the libxml option constants LIBXML_PARSEHUGE is dangerous, see http://symfony.com/blog/security-release-symfony-2-0-17-released

Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :
each() eachCrawler Crawlereach
each (\Closure $closure)
Calls an anonymous function on each node of the list.
The anonymous function receives the position and the node wrapped in a Crawler instance as arguments.
Example: $crawler->filter('h1')->each(function ($node, $i) { return $node->text(); });
Paramètres
\Closure$closure
An anonymous function
Renvoie
array An array of values returned by the anonymous function
eq() eqCrawler Crawlereq
eq (int $position)
Returns a node given its position in the node list.
Renvoie
static
Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :
evaluate() evaluateCrawler Crawlerevaluate
evaluate (string $xpath)
Evaluates an XPath expression.
Since an XPath expression might evaluate to either a simple type or a \DOMNodeList, this method will return either an array of simple types or a new Crawler instance.
Renvoie
array|Crawler
extract() extractCrawler Crawlerextract
extract (array $attributes)
Extracts information from the list of nodes.
You can extract attributes or/and the node value (_text).
Example: $crawler->filter('h1 a')->extract(['_text', 'href']); Renvoie
array
filter() filterCrawler Crawlerfilter
filter (string $selector)
Filters the list of nodes with a CSS selector.
This method only works if you have installed the CssSelector Symfony Component.
Renvoie
static
Exceptions
LogicException if the CssSelector Component is not available
filterXPath() filterXPathCrawler CrawlerfilterXPath
filterXPath (string $xpath)
Filters the list of nodes with an XPath expression.
The XPath expression is evaluated in the context of the crawler, which is considered as a fake parent of the elements inside it. This means that a child selector "div" or "./div" will match only the div elements of the current crawler, not their children.
Renvoie
static

reduce() reduceCrawler Crawlerreduce
reduce (\Closure $closure)
Reduces the list of nodes by calling an anonymous function.
To remove a node from the list, the anonymous function must return false.
Paramètres
\Closure$closure
An anonymous function

text() textCrawler Crawlertext
text (?string $default = null , bool $normalizeWhitespace = true )
Returns the text of the first node of the list.
Pass true as the second argument to normalize whitespaces.
Paramètres
string | null$default
When not null: the value to return when the current node is empty
bool$normalizeWhitespace
Whether whitespaces should be trimmed and normalized to single spaces
Renvoie
string

xpathLiteral() xpathLiteralCrawler CrawlerxpathLiteral
static xpathLiteral (string $s)[static]
Converts string for XPath expressions.
Escaped characters are: quotes (") and apostrophe (').
Examples:
echo Crawler::xpathLiteral('foo " bar'); //prints 'foo " bar'
echo Crawler::xpathLiteral("foo ' bar"); //prints "foo ' bar"
echo Crawler::xpathLiteral('a\'b"c'); //prints concat('a', "'", 'b"c')
Renvoie
string
